# arubacloud_snapshot (Resource)

Snapshot resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Create a block storage volume
resource "arubacloud_blockstorage" "example" {
  name          = "example-volume"
  project_id    = "your-project-id"
  location      = "ITBG-Bergamo"
  size_gb       = 50
  billing_period = "Hour"
  zone          = "ITBG-1"
  type          = "Standard"
}

# Create a snapshot of the volume
# Note: Use the URI attribute from the blockstorage resource
resource "arubacloud_snapshot" "example" {
  name          = "example-snapshot"
  project_id    = "your-project-id"
  location      = "ITBG-Bergamo"
  billing_period = "Hour"
  volume_id     = arubacloud_blockstorage.example.uri
  tags          = ["storage", "snapshot", "test"]
}
```



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema


### Arguments

The following arguments are supported:

#### Required

- `billing_period` (String) Billing period (only 'Hour' allowed)
- `location` (String) Snapshot location
- `name` (String) Snapshot name
- `project_id` (String) ID of the project this Snapshot belongs to
- `volume_id` (String) URI or ID of the volume this snapshot is for. Can be the volume URI (e.g., `/projects/{project_id}/providers/Aruba.Storage/volumes/{volume_id}`) or just the volume ID. If an ID is provided, the URI will be constructed automatically. **Recommended:** Use the `uri` attribute from the `arubacloud_blockstorage` resource.

#### Optional

- `tags` (List of String) List of tags for the snapshot

### Attributes Reference

In addition to all arguments above, the following attributes are exported:

#### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Snapshot identifier
- `uri` (String) Snapshot URI
